citation.article-title: Streptosporangium carneum sp. nov. isolated from soil.

p.s: Description of Streptosporangium carneum sp. nov.
Streptosporangium carneum (car. ne' um. L. adj. carneum, flesh colored, referring to the color of the aerial spore mass)
Cells are nonmotile, filamentous, and differentiated into substrate and aerial hyphae.
Aerial hyphae are predominantly light yellowish pink, and the vegetative mycelium is orange.
A light brown soluble pigment is produced on some media.
Aerial hyphae bear sporangia containing large, oval, nonmotile spores.

Acid is produced from cellobiose, fructose, galactose, glucose, lactose, mannose, and trehalose; no acid is produced from adonitol, D- and L-arabinose, cellulose, dextrin, dulcitol, ethanol, erythritol, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, maltose, mannitol, melezitose, melibiose, amethyl- D-glucoside, raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, salicin, sorbitol, L-sorbose, sucrose, xylitol, and D-xylose.
Assimilates acetate and pyruvate; does not assimilate benzoate, butyrate, citrate, formate, lactate, malate, mucate, oxalate, propionate, succinate, or tartrate.
Casein, hippurate, testosterone, and tyrosine are hydrolyzed or degraded; adenine, allantoin, calcium malate, elastin, esculin, guanine, hypoxanthine, starch, urea, and xanthine are not decomposed.
Catalase, phosphatase, and hydrogen sulfide are produced.
Melanoid pigments are not produced; gelatin is not liquefied.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Milk is neither hydrolyzed nor peptonized.
Unable to survive a temperature of 50°C for 8 h.
Growth occurs in the presence of 2% sodium chloride.
The temperature range for growth is 20 to 37°C.
Resistant to bacitracin, cephalothin, gentamicin, lincomycin, penicillin, streptomycin, tetracycline, and tobramycin.
Susceptible to neomycin, oleandomycin, rifampin, vancomycin, and lysozyme.
Type strain.
The type strain is strain A84575 (= NRRL 18437).
This strain was isolated from soil collected by the Tana River in Nairobi, Kenya.
